This module contains support to manipulate Windows registry.

A registry key must start with "HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE" ("HKLM") or "HKEY_USERS" ("HKU") or "HKEY_CURRENT_USER" ("HKCU") or "HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT" ("HKCR") or "HKEY_CURRENT_CONFIG" ("HKCC").

When running on 64-bit Windows if you want to read a value specific to the 64-bit environment you have to suffix the HK... with 64 i.e. HKLM64.

To access the (Default) value use "" (an empty string) for the value name.

When reading a REG_MULTI_SZ key the multiple entries are separated by '\0' - use with .split('\0') to get a seq of each entry.

It is possible to access remote registries by using a keyname in the form r"⧵⧵computername⧵keyname". To use this feature you must have the correct access rights.

Procs

proc `==`(a, b: RegData): bool {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Checks for equality between two RegData variables. 
proc regRead(key: string; value: string): RegData {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Reads a value from the registry.

Examples:

proc example() =
  echo regRead(r"HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion",
              "ProgramFilesDir")

proc regWrite(key: string): bool {...}{.discardable, raises: [], tags: [].}
Creates a key in the registry.

Examples:

proc example() =
  regWrite(r"HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\wAuto")

proc regWrite(key: string; name: string; value: RegData): bool {...}{.discardable, raises: [],
    tags: [].}
Creates a value in the registry.

Examples:

proc example() =
  regWrite(r"HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\wAuto", "Key1",
           RegData(kind: rkRegSz, data: "Test"))

proc regWrite(key: string; name: string; value: string): bool {...}{.discardable, raises: [],
    tags: [].}
Creates a value of REG_SZ type in the registry.

Examples:

proc example() =
  regWrite(r"HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\wAuto", "Key2", "Test")

proc regWrite(key: string; name: string; value: DWORD): bool {...}{.discardable, raises: [],
    tags: [].}
Creates a value of REG_DWORD type in the registry.

Examples:

proc example() =
  regWrite(r"HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\wAuto", "Key3", 12345)

proc regDelete(key: string; name: string): bool {...}{.discardable, raises: [], tags: [].}
Deletes a value from the registry.

Examples:

proc example() =
  regDelete(r"HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\wAuto", "Key3")

proc regDelete(key: string): bool {...}{.discardable, raises: [], tags: [].}
Deletes the entire key from the registry. Deleting from the registry is potentially dangerous--please exercise caution!

Examples:

proc example() =
  regDelete(r"HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\wAuto")

Iterators

iterator regKeys(key: string): string {...}{.raises: [IndexDefect], tags: [].}
Iterates over subkeys. 
iterator regValues(key: string): tuple[name: string, kind: RegKind] {...}{.
    raises: [IndexDefect], tags: [].}
Iterates over name and kind of values.
